Title: Receipt Measurement for Harvest Tax
Description: Rectangular wooden writing-tablet with the corners cut off at one end, written in demotic: a Receipt Measurement for Harvest Tax. The following names are mentioned in the inscription: Hor // Horos son of Nechouthes; Nechouthes; Herakleides
Technique: cut ((the board or the writing? Appears to be brushed like the others))
Curator's comments: Publication: U. Kaplony-Heckel, 'Pathyris I: Demotische Kurz-Texte in Cairo', Enchoria 19/20 (1992/93), 79-80, no. 29; K. Vandorpe and K. A. Worp, 'Paying Prostimon for new Vineyard Land (T. BM inv.no. EA 56920): A Bilingual Set of Wooden Tablets from the Archive of Horos, son of Nechouthes', CdE 88 (2013), 109-10.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (44924) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/44924)
